III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements;
Section staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 has previously told Youth A that he wanted to have a
relationship with Youth A. Youth A feels unsafe around Staff 1.
Staff 1 has not touched Youth A. Staff 1 has mentioned wanting a
relationship with Youth A, a couple times. Staff 1 is very caring
towards Youth A. Staff 1 has also sent Youth A, mixed signals.
Staff 1 would be nice to Youth A in the house. When Staff 1 is
outside of the home, he would talk negatively about Youth A, staff,
and other youths.
Investigation Administrator was interviewed face-to-face with MDHHS
Worker at the facility on 6/5/2025. She reported Youth A has
been doing well in the program and was referred because of
Youth A being a victim of human trafficking. Administrator
reported Youth A was interviewed by Law Enforcement and this
resulted in no Law Enforcement action. She reported speaking
with Youth A on 5/31/25 after being informed by Complainant of
the allegations. She reported being told by Youth A that Staff 1’s
mood sets the tone for the milieu and if in a bad mood everyone in
the house will also be in a bad mood. Administrator reported
Youth A stated a belief that Staff 1 was “hitting on” Youth A but
never said nor did anything physically with Youth A, Youth A could
just feel Staff 1’s energy. Administrator reported Youth A stated
Staff 1’s energy will make Youth A nervous, and Youth A becomes
uncomfortable by Youth A’s inability to read Staff 1’s moods at
times. She reported Youth A informed her that a couple of weeks
ago while playing cards, Staff 1 wanted to touch Youth A’s breasts
because he put his hands up. Administrator reported reviewing
camera footage over the past 2 weeks and never observed any
inappropriate behavior from Staff 1. Administrator reported on
6/2/25, she received a call from Youth A about staff and informed
Administrator that Staff 1 documented in a chat that Youth A had
asked Youth B to go after a staff. Administrator reported the staff
that showed the chat message to Youth A was terminated from
employment at that time. Administrator reported as a safety plan
because of this special investigation, Staff 1 has been moved to
2

another program on the campus and is not allowed any contact
with Youth A unless a crisis occurs.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face with the MDHHS Worker
at the facility on 6/5/2025. Youth A reported getting into a fight
with Youth C, Youth A noticed the energy in the house began to
move way up and then down. Youth A reported every time Staff 1
was working, her emotions were upside down and they began to
develop a relationship after Youth A told Staff 1 what was on her
mind. She was unable to recall the specifics of what was on her
mind when asked. Youth A reported having a belief that Staff 1
was giving her looks in a romantic way. She reported the “looks”
involved intense eye contact and “little jokes” that made it appear
to her that they were developing a relationship. Youth A reported
growing “feelings” for Staff 1 over time and believing that Staff 1
also had feelings for Youth A. Youth A was asked about specific
actions Staff 1 made that supported her believe they were in a
relationship, and she gave the following response; “We would joke
with each other” but Youth A was unable to recall what the jokes
were about other than to state “inside jokes” that were sexual in
nature. The other example Youth A shared is when she and Staff
1 were playing cards and Staff 1 made a gesture to cover the
cards on the table with his hands by laying his hands over the
cards laying on the table between them. Youth A reported a belief
that Staff 1 really wanted to touch her “boobs”, and this caused
Youth A to experience “a lot of emotions”. Youth A reported a
belief Staff 1 was trying to get close to Youth A's chest because
feelings come from the chest. Youth A denied Staff 1 ever touched
her physically. Youth A reported things changed when
miscommunication occurred between herself and Staff 1. Youth A
reported Staff 1 was having difficulty balancing his emotions and
his job, which came to light when Staff 1 wrote in a group chat for
work that Youth A was encouraging another youth to harm a youth
with a pen. After a terminated staff allowed Youth A to view the
chat, Youth A had “hurt feelings”. Youth A did not identify the two
youths that were spoken about in the chat. After this chat, Youth A
reported there were feelings every where in the house causing the
“house to feel big” which resulted in Youth A’s head to hurt. Youth
A reported feeling very confused and spoke with Complainant
about the issues between Youth A and Staff 1. Youth A reported
speaking to Administrator about the situation. Youth A reported
not seeing Staff 1 since speaking to Complainant and feeling safe
at the facility. Youth A reported not feeling safe emotionally when
Staff 1 was around but now the feelings have changed.
3

Quality Coordinator was interviewed face-to-face with the
MDHHS Worker at the facility on 6/5/2025. He reported
reviewing 2 weeks of video recording of the house and Staff 1 was
working in the house during 5 days of the 2 weeks of video
recording. Staff 1 was present on 5/18/25, 5/19/25, 5/22/25,
5/23/22, and 5/26/25, There were 3 youth in the home at the time
and the only time Staff 1 and Youth A were alone in the house
occurred on 5/18/25 between the hours of 6:48 pm to 8:50 pm. He
reported never witnessing any physical contact between Youth A
and Staff 1 at any time during the review. There were two times
Youth A and Staff 1 were in close space, and both occurred at the
table while they were playing cards which occurred on 5/18/25
and 5/19/25. He reported Youth A and Staff 1 appeared to laugh
“here and there” and Quality Coordinator believes Youth A tends
to joke a lot. This is based on his interactions (limited) with Youth
A. He reported no staff have shared any concerns about Youth A
and Staff 1’s interactions.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face with the MDHHS Worker
at the facility on 6/5/2025. He reported approximately a week
ago, Youth A became upset because Youth A was not given a
“car ride” and told Staff 1 Youth A would do everything in Youth
A’s power to get Staff 1 fired. He reported Youth A stated Staff 1
was a “member of the KKK” and Staff 2 shared having concerns
about Youth A. Staff 1 gave no details about his concerns. Staff 1
reported “car rides” are part of youth’s treatment plan and Youth A
was demanding that Youth A be taken for a ride. Staff 1 reported
taking Youth D for a ride because Youth A had been threatening
and wanting to fight Youth C. Staff 1 reported speaking with Youth
A approximately a week ago because he noticed a change in
Youth A’s behavior and attitude. He reported working with Youth A
since Youth A entered the program and believed they had a good
working relationship. Staff 1 reported Youth A was upset with Staff
1 because Youth A believed Staff 1 was being mean towards
Youth A but didn’t receive anything specific from Youth A about
the reason for this belief (Youth A reported during her interview it
was because of the chat). Staff 1 was asked about Youth A
believing they were in a relationship, and he stated, “it is
concerning that Youth A would think I would want a relationship
with her”. Staff 1 reported a belief that Youth A doesn’t understand
what a relationship would look like, and he denied ever sending
the “wrong signal” to Youth A. He reported Youth A stated,
“sometimes you (Staff 1) look at me (Youth A) and I (Youth A)
don’t know how I (Youth A) should feel”. Staff 1 believes Youth A
feels threatened when others look at her causing dysregulation for
Youth A. Staff 1 was asked about the “hands on card” situation
4

brought up by Youth A and he was unable to recall the specific
incident. He did report he would never touch a youth
inappropriately nor make gestures to do so.
Complainant was interviewed via phone on 7/1/2025. She
reported having no further information to provide and received the
information from Youth A. She reported Youth A only spoke of the
allegations once and never again. Youth A informed Complainant
a belief that Staff 1 wanted a relationship with Youth A because
Youth A was receiving “mixed messages” from Staff 1.
Attempts to contact Staff 2:
• 6/11/25: Phone call with message for call back being left on
voice mail
• 7/2/25: Phone call with message for call back being left on
voice mail
• 7/7/25: Phone call with message for call back being left on
voice mail
• 7/14/25: Phone call with message for call back being left on

Documents Reviewed:
MDHHS interview with Staff 2 dated 7/1/25. A return call was
received from Staff 2. Introductions were made over the phone,
and the identity of Staff 2 was verified by DOB. Staff 2 was asked
if he had any concerns regarding interactions between Youth A
and Staff 1 and Staff 2 denied having any concerns. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 is "a solid staff member" and he is known to be
strict with the children, which some youth think makes him unfair.
Staff 2 stated Youth A did not like Staff 1 much and would yell at
him and argue with him during the shifts that Staff 1 worked with
her. Staff 2 stated they had a lot of disagreements and she did not
handle it well when Staff 1 would tell her no when she asked to do
something. Staff 2 stated Staff 1 and Youth A did not appear to
be close. Staff 2 explained the incident that occurred at the end of
May when Youth A and Youth E called Law Enforcement (LE) on
him and Staff 1. Staff 2 reported Youth A and Youth E wanted to
go for a therapy car ride, but him and Staff 1 were unable to take
them on one since there was no safety plan in place for them to
go on a car ride. Staff 2 stated they became upset over being told
no and Youth E called LE on them, stating that they were not
doing their jobs because they wouldn't take them on a car ride.
Staff 2 reported when Youth A first arrived at St John's, she
appeared to be very smart and would do research on the planets
5

and other science related topics. Staff 2 stated as the weeks went
on, Youth A became more paranoid being around the other youth
in the residential program and would become angry when people
would look at her. Staff 2 stated again that he did not have any
concerns for any interactions between Staff 1 and Youth A .
Video Review was completed by Quality Coordinator. This
was completed by Quality Coordinator because a specific day and
time was not established. A review of each of the days and times
Staff 1 was working in the house were reviewed and there was no
evidence of any inappropriate behavior by Staff 1 observed
according to Quality Coordinator.
D.A. Blodgett St. John’s Youth Development Specialist
Procedures dated 4/2025. This document outlines Youth
Development Specialists (YDS) role and responsibilities. It stated
that staff will maintain clear and appropriate boundaries. This
involves staff not engaging in personal conversations where the
purpose of sharing information is not of benefit to the youth. All
staff are also required to speak to youth in a manner that
promotes dignity and respect.
HR file for Staff 1 was reviewed. Documentation indicates Staff
1 was hired on 9/6/2022 and there is no disciplinary action
documented in the file. Staff 1 is also up to date on his required
trainings including “DABDSJ Human Trafficking training”.
Walk-through:
A walk-through was completed at the facility. The facility is a
multiple story building in good repair and very clean. All required
furnishing are present, and Youth A’s room was examined. The
bedroom is furnished appropriately.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as evidenced by interviews with
staff, youth, documents and video recording. Evidence does not
support the allegations that Staff 1 had an inappropriate
relationship with Youth A. Youth A may be experiencing a
traumatic response resulting in Youth A’s misreading of her
environment.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was offered regarding the need to train staff
in ensuring boundaries are set when engaging in interactions with
youth, especially those youth who experience trauma cycles
6

related to being victims of Human Trafficking. Because of the
trauma associated with this issue, these youth struggle to develop
healthy relationships leading to unhealthy thinking, emotions, and
behaviors.
Technical assistance was offered regarding the need to discuss
this issue with the treatment team so steps can be established to
keep this type of situation from occurring in the future with other
youth entering the program.
Technical assistance was offered regarding what information is
shown to youth such as the chat between staff. Staff need to have
a refresher on the importance of avoiding things that could trigger
youth especially those youth who go into a trauma cycle when
triggered.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
